title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the context for nested classes is not correctly identified. Currently, when creating a new class for a nested class, the 'Enclosing Type' field does not populate with the current type in the editor.
OB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard is blank when creating a new class for a nested class.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard should default to the current type in the editor when creating a new class for a nested class.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click the new class button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard.
